title: P and Q together have 3 times what Q and R have, while P, Q, and R together have thirty rupees more than P. If Q has 5 times what R has, then what amount does P have? - Quora

response.answer_text: As mentioned in question P+Q= 3(Q+R) ------Equation 1 P+Q+R= P+30 ---------Equation 2 Q= 5R - - ————- Equation 3 From Equation 1 P- 3R = 2Q Put the value of Q from equation 3 P- 3R = 10R P= 13R From Equation 2 Q+R= 30 Put the value of Q from equation 3 5R+R= 30 R= 5 P= 13R= 13*5= 65 Stay Home 🙏 Stay Safe 🙏 Enjoy Learning
P+Q=3(Q+R). hence P+5R=3(6R) hence P=18R-5R=13R p+Q+R=30+P. hence 13R+5R+R=13R+30 hence 6R=30. hence R=5 Rupees Q=5R Q=25 Rupees P=13R=65 Rupees
